attributes.action: enforce setting electronic ignition systems on all new vehicles limiting maximum speed to 70 mph
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are told that speed is a major factor in death and injury on British Roads; it is also felt contributes to higher emissions. All car manufactures have the technology to set maximum speeds within their vehicles by setting the ‘black box’ or ignition electronics.

The maximum speed limit is 70 mph yet vehicles sold far exceed this. If manufactures governed speed this should see further reductions in death, injury, road racing, emission, fuel consumption and eventual elimination of motorway speeding.

Current vehicles with electronic ignition systems could be ‘chipped’ to govern speed – at the government / manufactures / owners cost. Tampering with ignition systems would be enforced with large fines, licence points, destruction and recycling of the vehicle, without exception.

Historic / other vehicles that do not have electronic systems and are found speeding would be subject to the vehicle receiving 'points' despite ownership and destroyed when a set maximum is reached.
